sentences: Stoessel was born in Buenos Aires, the daughter of Mariana Muzlera and television director and producer Alejandro Stoessel.

sentences: She has a brother, Francisco, who is one year older than her.
section: == Life and career == | === 1997–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Stoessel began her artistic training at a young age studying singing, piano, musical comedy, musical theater, and dance in her native Buenos Aires.

sentences: Stoessel was educated at two private bilingual schools: Colegio San Marcos and Colegio Martín y Omar de San Isidro.
section: == Life and career == | === 1997–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2007, Stoessel had a role in the first season of the popular Argentine children's telenovela, Patito Feo, as "Martina", one of Fito Bernardi's assistants.

sentences: In June 2021, Stoessel gave an interview for the fashion magazine Vanity Teen, reviewing her career and her influence as a woman in today's society.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: On 21 June 2021, Stoessel appeared alongside rapper Duki on the remix of musical duo MYA's song "2:50".
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: The remix peaked at number three on Argentina Hot 100.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: On 2 July 2021, Stoessel collaborated alongside singers Lola Índigo and Belinda on the song "La Niña de la Escuela" from the former's album La Niña.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: On 19 August 2021, Stoessel released "Maldita Foto", a collaboration with singer Manuel Turizo, as the second single from her upcoming fourth album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: Stoessel appeared alongside Danny Ocean on the song "Tú no me conoces", released on 1 October 2021.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: On 30 October 2021, Stoessel held a concert at Posadas, attended by more than 100,000 people and thus broke her record.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: On 11 November 2021, Stoessel released "Bar", a collaboration with singer L-Gante, as the third single from her upcoming fourth album, and she announced the following day a concert tour Tini Tour 2022 supporting the album, set to begin on 21 March 2022.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: "Bar" debuted at number six on Argentina Hot 100 and the song's top ten debut on the chart made Stoessel and L-Gante artists appearing on Hot Shot Debut.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: The song later peaked at number one on Argentina Hot 100, becoming Stoessel's second number-one single on the chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: On 26 November 2021, Stoessel contributed to the soundtrack of the animated film Koati with a song titled "Vueltas en Tu Mente".
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: On 29 November 2021, in an interview with Glamour Mexico, Stoessel announced that her fourth album will be released in 2022 and that she has experimented with new musical genres and collaborated with several artists on it, and she also revealed that she's starring in a Chinese period drama film titled The Diary, directed by Jackie Chan, and that the movie's release date got delayed to 2022 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

sentences: On 9 December 2021, Stoessel released a song titled "Aquí Estoy" as part of her second collaboration with Pantene, coinciding with the release of the music video featuring the winners of the Aquí Estoy Challenge and the promotional livestream concert titled Aquí Estoy Show.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present: Upcoming fourth studio album ===

== Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: Musical style ===
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: While working on Violetta, Stoessel met with pop music and Latin music.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: She later transferred the pop sound to her first solo album Tini (Martina Stoessel).
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: As Stoessel matured on her second album Quiero Volver, she began to use the more serious sound of Latin music.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: Later in her third album Tini Tini Tini, Stoessel experimented with genres that are common to her country and that she has not yet tried, such as reggaeton, cumbia, urban and trap music.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: In addition, Stoessel is also recognizable by her romantic ballads.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: She also used in the poem with tango and said that "tango and reggaeton is something that represents Argentina and all Argentines.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: Those genres represent the Argentine heritage.".
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===
== Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: Influences ===
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: Even before being released by Disney, and even more because of that, Stoessel was already a fan and was inspired throughout her career by Miley Cyrus, Demi Lovato and Selena Gomez, who, like her, were successful protagonists in Disney Channel's series and later launched themselves in the music industry.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: She was even questioned by the media if she would follow the same path, sometimes controversial, of some of them and she stated that each one does what they like and follows their own road, she would not follow the same path as the other Disney stars.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: As Stoessel grew in her profession as a singer, she also had other inspirations.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: In 2019, in an interview with Seventeen magazine in Mexico, when asked which was the biggest of them, Stoessel replied: "Beyoncé!
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: She's awesome, I love her.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: I love everything she does, her music, her shows are amazing, how she dances...
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: I like that you can see how she is present in the smallest details.".
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: This was already confirmed in previous years by her visual style (she worked with stylist Paula Selby Avellaneda, who worked with Beyoncé), her live performances and choreographies.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: Stoessel has always made clear her admiration and how much she is a fan of the singer, citing her on her YouTube channel in 2016 as the person who she would most like to collaborate with.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===

sentences: While in the Latin world, Stoessel said that she grew up listening to Daddy Yankee and Alejandro Sanz, with whom she recorded a ballad "Un Beso en Madrid", which she described as "dream come true" .
section: == Artistry == | === Influences ===
== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Stoessel resided in San Isidro, Buenos Aires with her parents and her brother, until she temporarily moved to Miami, Florida, due to the expansion of her music career.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She speaks Spanish (her native language), Italian, and English.
section: == Personal life ==
== Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: Relationships ===
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: In 2013, Stoessel started dating fellow Argentine actor Peter Lanzani.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: After two years of dating, they broke up in April 2015.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: They got back together in the summer of the same year, but broke up again in December 2015.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: In September 2016, Stoessel announced that she started dating Spanish model Pepe Barroso Silva, who was a guest star in the music video for "Great Escape".
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: In February 2018, Stoessel announced that she and Silva are no longer dating, but they got back together in May 2018.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: On 22 December 2018, Stoessel announced that she and Silva broke up again.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: On 10 June 2019, during the Martin Fierro awards ceremony, Stoessel announced that she started dating Colombian singer and frequent collaborator Sebastián Yatra.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: In May 2020, it was announced that Stoessel and Yatra broke up.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: On 10 August 2013, Stoessel performed, along with the cast of Violetta, at the UNICEF television charity event Un sol para los chicos, where she sang the songs, "Ser Mejor" and "En Mi Mundo".
section: == Other ventures == | === Activism and philanthropy ===

sentences: On 17 November 2016, Stoessel was named an honorary ambassador of the world peace by fellow human rights activist Adolfo Pérez Esquivel and Guatemalan political activist Rigoberta Menchú, at the Red voz por la paz ceremony in Buenos Aires.
section: == Other ventures == | === Activism and philanthropy ===

sentences: She is also a philanthropist and uses her fame as a platform to positively influence the lives of people around her.
section: == Other ventures == | === Activism and philanthropy ===

sentences: In August 2018 and 2019, Stoessel participated again in Un sol para los chicos, a solidarity campaign for the benefit of UNICEF.
section: == Other ventures == | === Activism and philanthropy ===

sentences: Stoessel became a part of UNICEF's protect #GeneracionUnica for the rights of every child.
